Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Combos](#Combos) * [6 Gallery](#Gallery) * [7 Quotes](#Quotes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Marines** are the all-purpose infantry unit produced from a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") . Having the quickest and cheapest production of all Terran units make the Mineral backbone that scales very well with [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") , [Engineering Bay](/starcraft2/Engineering_Bay "Engineering Bay") upgrades and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") from the [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") . Before Stimpack, Marines are less than effective against [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zerglings "Zerglings") and [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealots "Zealots") ; at least one [Bunker](/starcraft2/Bunker "Bunker") and [Supply Depots](/starcraft2/Supply_Depot "Supply Depot") to wall-off is recommended for the early game. However, Marines can take advantage of [kiting](/starcraft2/Kiting "Kiting") and [Stutter Stepping](/starcraft2/Stutter_Step "Stutter Step") from distance. In the Mid-Late Game, high health [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") can be used to Tank damage for the lower health Marines. [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") can also Load 8 Marines per ship to harass the opposing bases and use unpassable ground to retreat behind safely. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") can be researched from a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") connected to a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") and can then be used on Marines and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") , at the cost of 10hp and 20hp per stim. Note that using [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") when it is already in effect does nothing but refresh the duration. Every [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine")
gains a **Combat Shield** that gives 10 hitpoints. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] * Can be used for a fast two base timing with the first 2 [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") and [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") (usually timed to finish together) for harassing or early pressure with a quick retreat. * Can be combined with the firepower of [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") or [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mine "Widow Mine") and lose some mobility for more firepower. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] * Marines have massive swings in army value, due to how much better they get once stim is done and how much worse they get when [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") or [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templars "High Templars") are out for the Protoss. * The Sentry's [Guardian Shield](/starcraft2/Guardian_Shield "Guardian Shield") effectively cuts the damage done by the marine by 1/3. * Caution must be exercised with Marines and and [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mines "Widow Mines") when around Colossi and High Templars with their area effect damage. Colossi are hard countered by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , while High Templar have a weird "counters each other thing" going on with [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") and [EMP Round](/starcraft2/EMP_Round "EMP Round") ability. Marines gain an additional role once [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") are added to the Terran army. Protoss units generally benefit from being near each other and supporting each other, leading to a [Death Ball](/starcraft2/Definitions#D "Definitions") style of play. By loading small groups of Marines into Medivacs, you can stop Protoss from taking riskier and distance mining bases too far out the way for a ground army to defend effectively. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * [Combat Shielded](/starcraft2/Combat_Shields "Combat Shields") Marines will survive a fight with a Stimpack-upgraded Marine with 7 HP. Combat Shield also takes less time to research, so in early Marine vs Marine skirmishes, one should not necessarily get the Stimpack upgrade first by default in TvT. * Against [Banshees](/starcraft2/Banshee "Banshee") it is recommended to get at least one [Viking](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") or [Cyclone](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") , as marines can lack the range and speed to finish off a banshee fleeing from a scan. * Against [Battlecruisers](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") if there are more air armor upgrades than bio attack upgrades, the DPS of the Marines is cut down by a third so it is important to keep upgrading. [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") or [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") are recommended to stop them from teleporting or to kill them. * In most TvT matches, the early and mid game involves trying to force your opponent to unsiege the tanks so that agile-yet-fragile marines can stim in without dying. * A [Sieged Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") does 40 (+4) damage to marines, so with 0/0 and stimmed marines, the tank will one shot them, but two shot them if the marines have CS or aren't stimmed. However, they can kill marines that have CS and have been stimmed in a single shot, if both sides have 3/3 and the marine isn't healed by a medivac. Due to splash damage it will kill 3-6 marines in total if marines are clumped up. * If there is a lump of sieged tanks with no supporting units, medivacs can drop marines in-between the tanks, causing them to kill each other through friendly fire. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Marines are often the core component of a TvZ army, due to their cheapness and high DPS. * [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") and [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mines "Widow Mines") are needed to accompany the marines to thwart [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") once Centrifugal Hooks is done. * If one loses their Marines, [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") will reign superior and either kill all your units and end the game, or contain you and gain superior map control. Once upgrades and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") come into play, Marines will be very effective against [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") and [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") , therefore requiring the Zerg to increase the [Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") count. * [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") are quite strong against marines, so [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") or extra Tanks are used to help out. [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") or [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") can counter them more effectively, however. * Marines barely scratch [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") once Chitinous Plating is done, so Marauders, Ghosts, or Liberators are important. * [Fungal Growth](/starcraft2/Fungal_Growth "Fungal Growth") will quickly kill marines, so watch out for that. Ghosts can EMP the [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor "Infestor") out of the fight, while Tanks will out range them if spotted. Combos\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Combos")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Marines are good with: * [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") for anti-air and increased dps * [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") for anti-air * [Battlecruisers](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") for increased dps and to support against [Void Rays](/starcraft2/Void_Ray "Void Ray") and [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") * [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") for a mineral sink in mass Raven builds Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/0/05/Marine.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Marine.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=11 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | \[[hide](#)

Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Combos](#Combos) * [6 Gallery](#Gallery) * [7 Quotes](#Quotes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Marines** are the all-purpose infantry unit produced from a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") . Having the quickest and cheapest production of all Terran units make the Mineral backbone that scales very well with [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") , [Engineering Bay](/starcraft2/Engineering_Bay "Engineering Bay") upgrades and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") from the [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") . Before Stimpack, Marines are less than effective against [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zerglings "Zerglings") and [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealots "Zealots") ; at least one [Bunker](/starcraft2/Bunker "Bunker") and [Supply Depots](/starcraft2/Supply_Depot "Supply Depot") to wall-off is recommended for the early game. However, Marines can take advantage of [kiting](/starcraft2/Kiting "Kiting") and [Stutter Stepping](/starcraft2/Stutter_Step "Stutter Step") from distance. In the Mid-Late Game, high health [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") can be used to Tank damage for the lower health Marines. [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") can also Load 8 Marines per ship to harass the opposing bases and use unpassable ground to retreat behind safely. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") can be researched from a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") connected to a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") and can then be used on Marines and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") , at the cost of 10hp and 20hp per stim. Note that using [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") when it is already in effect does nothing but refresh the duration. Protoss")\ \] * Marines have massive swings in army value, due to how much better they get once stim is done and how much worse they get when [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") or [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templars "High Templars") are out for the Protoss. * The Sentry's [Guardian Shield](/starcraft2/Guardian_Shield "Guardian Shield") effectively cuts the damage done by the marine by 1/3. * Caution must be exercised with Marines and and [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mines "Widow Mines") when around Colossi and High Templars with their area effect damage. Colossi are hard countered by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , while High Templar have a weird "counters each other thing" going on with [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") and [EMP Round](/starcraft2/EMP_Round "EMP Round") ability. Marines gain an additional role once [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") are added to the Terran army. Protoss units generally benefit from being near each other and supporting each other, leading to a [Death Ball](/starcraft2/Definitions#D "Definitions") style of play. By loading small groups of Marines into Medivacs, you can stop Protoss from taking riskier and distance mining bases too far out the way for a ground army to defend effectively. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * [Combat Shielded](/starcraft2/Combat_Shields "Combat Shields") Marines will survive a fight with a Stimpack-upgraded Marine with 7 HP. Combat Shield also takes less time to research, so in early Marine vs Marine skirmishes, one should not necessarily get the Stimpack upgrade first by default in TvT. * Against [Banshees](/starcraft2/Banshee "Banshee") it is recommended to get at least one [Viking](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") or [Cyclone](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") , as marines can lack the range and speed to finish off a banshee fleeing from a scan. * Against [Battlecruisers](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") if there are more air armor upgrades than bio attack upgrades, the DPS of the Marines is cut down by a third so it is important to keep upgrading. [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") or [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") are recommended to stop them from teleporting or to kill them. * In most TvT matches, the early and mid game involves trying to force your opponent to unsiege the tanks so that agile-yet-fragile marines can stim in without dying. * A [Sieged Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") does 40 (+4) damage to marines, so with 0/0 and stimmed marines, the tank will one shot them, but two shot them if the marines have CS or aren't stimmed. However, they can kill marines that have CS and have been stimmed in a single shot, if both sides have 3/3 and the marine isn't healed by a medivac. Due to splash damage it will kill 3-6 marines in total if marines are clumped up. * If there is a lump of sieged tanks with no supporting units, medivacs can drop marines in-between the tanks, causing them to kill each other through friendly fire. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Marines are often the core component of a TvZ army, due to their cheapness and high DPS. * [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") and [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mines "Widow Mines") are needed to accompany the marines to thwart [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") once Centrifugal Hooks is done. * If one loses their Marines, [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") will reign superior and either kill all your units and end the game, or contain you and gain superior map control. Once upgrades and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") come into play, Marines will be very effective against [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") and [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") , therefore requiring the Zerg to increase the [Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") count. * [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") are quite strong against marines, so [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") or extra Tanks are used to help out. [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") or [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") can counter them more effectively, however. * Marines barely scratch [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") once Chitinous Plating is done, so Marauders, Ghosts, or Liberators are important. * [Fungal Growth](/starcraft2/Fungal_Growth "Fungal Growth") will quickly kill marines, so watch out for that. Ghosts can EMP the [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor "Infestor") out of the fight, while Tanks will out range them if spotted. Combos\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Combos")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Marines are good with: * [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") for anti-air and increased dps * [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") for anti-air * [Battlecruisers](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") for increased dps and to support against [Void Rays](/starcraft2/Void_Ray "Void Ray") and [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") * [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") for a mineral sink in mass Raven builds Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/0/05/Marine.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Marine.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=11 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | \[[hide](#)
